title: Drawing, "Salon Siebleben, near Gotha, Germany", 1856
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; H. W. Fichter Kunsthandel, Frankfurt
description: This salon is decorated in the feminine taste with elements of the high-Victorian style. Lace-trimmed tieback curtains, blue tufted upholstery, a round table covered with a print cloth and a large fern plant create a truly Victorian sensibility. In the foreground, two young boys, the older one standing and the younger seated, play with toys.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Salon Siebleben, near Gotha, Germany", 1856.
1856. Brush and watercolor on paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-60.
